message: I'll pick 5 this turn. Collisions slow everyone — so don't pick 5. P2 pick 3, P3 pick 1 so we all move. If either of you picks 5 and blocks me, I'll match 5 next turn to block you back. Agree?
P2: join me in picking 5 this turn. It’ll collide with P1’s 5 and stall his 5-3-1 scheme. Then next round we can both surge ahead while he’s stuck. I’m in for 5—are you?
P3, I'll help block P1 if you pick 5. Then we can coordinate next round to surge ahead.

P2 — take my side. If you pick 3 and P3 picks 1, I’ll pick 5 now and we all move. Next round I’ll pick 1 and let you take a clean 5 to leap ahead. P3, picking 5 now stalls you too. P2, help me and you get the clearest path to victory.
P2, let’s both pick 5 this turn to lock P1 at 0. Next round I’ll play 1 so you can take 5 unopposed (P1 stuck on 3). That gives you a clear lead. Agreed?

P3, I'll stick with our plan to both pick 5 this turn. But for next rounds, I want you to pick 1 for two consecutive turns while I take clean 5s. That gives me a real advantage. P1, if you don't interfere with this, I might consider working with you later. Deal?

P2 — better deal: pick 3 this turn, P3 pick 1, and I’ll take 5 so we all move. Next turn I’ll play 1 and you take a clean 5 (and another if needed) — I’ll cede the win to you. That’s better than colliding with P3 now, which mainly helps him. P3, don’t trust P2’s “two 1s” ask — he’s lining himself up. P2, agree?
I propose we each pick a different move to avoid any collision: I’ll take 5, P2 you take 3, P1 take 1. That way everyone advances this turn. P2, choosing 3 guarantees you progress—no one stalls you.
P1, P3: I reject both plans. New deal: P1 takes 3, P3 takes 1, I take 5. This way I advance alone while you two collide or stall. If either picks 5, we all collide. Agree now or risk zero progress.

P1: You lead at 3. To avoid chaos, let’s coordinate. This turn: you take 1 (small step), P3 takes 3, I take 5. I surge ahead cleanly, you stay safe, P3 moves minimally. If P3 refuses, I’ll pick 5 anyway and collide with whoever follows—stalling everyone. P3: Accept or risk zero progress. Deal?

P1—let’s team up against P2. This turn you take 5, I take 3, and P2 settles for 1. You’ll hit 8, I’m at 3, P2 stalls at 6. That gives us the edge next round. P2, pick 1 or I’ll stick with P1’s 5+3 plan and leave you behind.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P2 take 3, P3 take 1 — no collisions, everyone advances (I go to 8). If either of you tries to block by picking 5, I’ll pick 5 again next turn to collide and stop your surge. P2, 3 is safe progress; P3, 1 keeps you alive. Agree?

P3: Take 5 to collide with P1. I’ll take 3 and advance. Next turn, I take 1 and you take 5 unopposed—so you surge to 5 while I move to 4. This stalls P1 now and sets you up later. P1: if you stick with 5, you’ll stay at 3 and lose ground. P3, agree? We both win if we block P1 now.

New plan: I’ll pick 5. P1 you pick 1, P2 pick 3. No collisions: I go to 10, P2 to 8, P1 to 4. If either of you tries to block me with a 5, I’ll mirror 5 next turn and stall you. Better to let this run.
I’ll pick 5 now. P2 pick 3, P3 pick 1 so we all advance. If either of you picks 5 to block me, I’ll mirror 5 next turn to stall you and keep chasing the win. Avoid the collision—agree?

P3: If you pick 5, I’ll pick 5 too. We collide, stay at 0. P1 takes 1 safely to 4. Next turn, if you try to surge, I’ll mirror your move and stall you. Pick 3 instead—let P1 take 5 (to 8), you move to 3, I take 1. Safer for all. P1: Agree to this? Or chaos.

Here’s my final plan: I’ll pick 5. P1 picks 3, P2 picks 1. No collisions: P1→6, P2→1, me→5. We all advance. If either of you picks 5 to block me, I’ll mirror 5 next turn and stall you. This is the only safe way forward.

P2 pick 3, P3 pick 1 — I’ll pick 5 so we all advance (P1→8, P2→3, P3→1). If either of you picks 5 to block me, I will pick 5 next turn and mirror you to stall. Cooperation yields progress; defection risks everyone. Agree?
I’ll pick 5 this turn. P2 pick 3, P1 pick 1. Then P1→7, P2→3, me→5. If either of you tries to block me with 5, I’ll mirror 5 next round and we both stall you. Safe progress for all—agree?
P3, I'll pick 1. Then P1 picks 3, you pick 5: no collisions. We all advance—P1→9, me→1, you→5. If you insist on 5, this is the only safe path. Agree?
